Articles.Content: Launch 3-5 Kerbans into the space environment using a rocket or shuttle. Make all of them do an EVA. Speed up time 1,000 for 5 minutes. Launch a new rocket and try to capture them. Bonus points if they're all tourists. I tried this. I ended up with 5 unrecoverable Kerbans that are out of EVA fuel.

2 hours ago, TedJet Aerospace said:

Launch 3-5 Kerbans into the space environment using a rocket or shuttle. Make all of them do an EVA. Speed up time 1,000 for 5 minutes. Launch a new rocket and try to capture them. Bonus points if they're all tourists.

Oh, yes! I would want bonus points for convincing tourists to do an EVA.

SCNR!

formatting

Definitely need bonus points for tourist EVA. Is there even a mod that does that?

 

Methinks someone hasn't got much KSP experience. @TedJet Aerospace this is why you should always do a challenge idea first, exploring every angle you can before posting it. That way it saves you ridicule for getting things wrong or suggesting impossible things like tourist EVA. 

Welcome to the forum, and good luck on your next challenge.

@TedJet Aerospace Your mission now, should you choose to accept it, is to hunt down those five 'unrecoverable' kerbals and recover them anyway. Yes, it can be done. I recommend the liberal use of klaws, heat shields and parachutes, and you are most likely best off launching five small drones to maximize your odds of recovering at least one of the kerbals. Each fiery death will result in valuable lessons on how to approach the next victim.

I would be delighted to see screenshots of your successes and failures, and of course proof of a successful mission is always welcome.

Good luck! And fly safe.

10 hours ago, dnbattley said:

This may actually be possible, after a fashion, by using EVA seats and an automated "scraping" mechanism...

I don't believe it, but that does work! You can put a tourist into an external command seat, and then "eject" them into space. And while it is not necessary to automate this, sequencing the ejection of a couple of useless - errr - paying guests makes for a nice "firework" (or Kerbalwork?).

Once they are on EVA they can be controlled in the same way as trained Kerbals.
